website_summaries.verdict: The Onkyo TX-NR636 offers a compelling mix of features and performance with "future-proofing" that is unparalleled for the money.
pros: The Onkyo TX-NR636 has a laundry list of features including Dolby Atmos support and High-Resolution Audio streaming
HDMI 2.0 and HDCP 2.2 means the receiver is potentially more future-proof than its competitors
cons: On-screen display is minimal and difficult to read

customer_reviews.title: Randomly shuts off- great when it works. But not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: Randomly shuts off. Apparently unfixable. Bought "like new" on Amazon, but was outside warranty to save a few bucks. DON'T. Worked fine for a few months. Paid authorized Onkyo servicer to look at they said it only needed firmware update. A few months later it started randomly shutting off again. It's going into protection mode, apparently there's a internal short somewhere. Some of the time. Once in a while I can get it to stay on. Lots of complaints on AVS Forum about this model just randomly going into protection mode (random shutoff). It's great when it works. But if you buy it, make sure it's still under warranty!
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy Onkyo, period.
customer_reviews.text: 9 months in and the unit makes a constant clicking noise all day while using it, I believe it may be a fan or possibly a switch inside the unit, and it's loud and annoying. I am also now experiencing the HDMI signal drop out. 3-4 times per day. I've contacted Onkyo and these guys are the largest bunch of clueless, non-caring folks i've dealt with in a long while. Clearly back east, heavy accent who come off like they could care less about their own product or customer. They offer no cross shipping, and you should expect your unit to be gone for a month. Simply unacceptable in today's market.
customer_reviews.author: Fo

customer_reviews.title: HDMI issues from the start - STAY AWAY!!
customer_reviews.text: HDMI issues - picture will go black - sometimes it comes back on, sometimes it doesn't. Sometimes the audio goes out, too. The technician from geek squad says he has seen quite a few problems with Onkyo receivers. He said go with Denon or Yamaha...they don't break. Very disappointed that I can't send this back as it's beyond Amazon's return period. Not sure if we want to go thru the hassle of warranty service. My advice - STAY AWAY from this brand.
customer_reviews.author: V. McManus

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS UNIT (if you want sound from your Home Theatre system!)
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS UNIT!!!!! I am a former, long-time fan of Onkyo. The TX-NR636 stopped playing sound about four months after I purchased it. I called Onkyo, who told me to call Amazon. I called Amazon, and they were absolutely ZERO HELP, the agent said it was out of the 30-day return period, that I needed to call Onkyo, and then he hung up. Thanks Amazon! PS, Onkyo's customer service was not much better. Now I have to ship it out of state for warranty repair at my own expense. The Independent Service Center that Onkyo told me to ship it to told me this was a very common problem with this particular unit
customer_reviews.author: Randall Gann

customer_reviews.title: ONKYO as good as ever!
customer_reviews.text: I have always favored Onkyo - however my last unit was a pioneer and what a mistake that was. The Onkyo is amazing and continues to reinforce my brand loyalty. The bluetooth and network functionality is incredibly facile to setup and use (usually not the case with these types of heavily proprietary items) and the amp makes everything look and sound absolutely fantastic - the difference is OBVIOUS, my wife was amazed. I bought this unit with an Onkyo CD Player and my music library has never sounded so good. Good luck convincing me to ever buy a non-Onkyo component again! Would highly recommend and would buy again in an instant.
customer_reviews.author: DOC

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great home receiver. Was looking for something to replace my older Onkyo that didn't have HDMI switching so that I didn't have to run so many cables through the wall or use a separate HDMI switch. This thing handles everything I throw at it and upconverts beautifully. Have also used the built-in Pandora, the Bluetooth, and both the Android and iOS apps with it and have no complaints. Plenty of power with my 5.1 setup, and I plan to use the second channel for putting speakers in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Adam K

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasts!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on Jan 2 of 2016 and was very happy with it's performance. I set it up in my entertainment center and never moved it... Then on April 4 of 2016 it never powered up again. No lights....no sound...no nothing. The "Standby" light doesn't even come on. There is a short click when I press the power button (like it's going to power up), then another click (like it's powering off) shortly after...but no lights ever come on. The sound and video quality was awesome while it lasted...but it's now on it's way back to the shop... Not Happy...
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Great box. Great upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid of the issue that some had with either the HDMI going out or the thing actually popping and smoking, but after a long time, I've realized it is going strong. This thing has been a great improvement over a cheaper receiver I had. Has more power and the sound quality is great. I love the bluetooth too. Very easy to get setup and working. It is pretty big, but still looks great in my entertainment system. The interface is alright. It can be slow when working with dlna, but that might just be my computer. I would recommend this. I think the HDMI issues have passed.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: Superior amplifier/receiver, but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a superior amplifier/receiver. It works well with HDMI video/sound input as well as broadcast radio reception. I would have given it a five star if it was easier to switch the Zone2 on and off and sync it with the main speakers. I found that it was so complicated that I installed an external switch (TC-8) that allows me to power the Zone 2 speakers with the same signal I send to the main speakers. I like to keep life simple when I can.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Love the receiver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in Dec to replace my Onkyo TX-SR705 that I've had since 2007. This receiver had almost all of the same features plus new ones that have come out since the old one was released. Love the receiver. No complaints at all. I'm using with my Samsung Blu-ray player, Toshiba HD-DVD player, and DishNetwork box connected and viewing on my projector. I have a decent, not cheap but not the top of the line, set of speakers from Polk and the sound is amazing in my home theater.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Faulty
customer_reviews.text: This was my second Onkyo Receiver in 10 years. they sound great when they work. However, the NR 636 has a problem of shutting itself off after being turned on. There was no ventilation issues where it was set up. It had it's own power source. It was seldom used. Etc, etc. After checking it out on the internet, I found this to be a common problem with no good solution. I will not be buying a third Onkyo receiver. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: Tony321

customer_reviews.title: worst ever receiver
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT buy this unit, of so many receiver I had in the past, this is the ONLY ONE WORST EVER. Very complicated manual, difficult to use, please do not waste your money and you time in this piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: JESSY

customer_reviews.title: Buy 2 and configure a powerful 10.1 surround system!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of the 626's. An excellent receiver for the price! I bought both for about 600$. By running them off a split optical output from my t.v. I have been able to configure my home theater to a 10.4 setup with way more power than an entry-level 10.1 receiver which would cost more than the 2 626's
customer_reviews.author: joshua fritz

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver...
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for a few months now. Upgraded to this from a TX-NR509 so it was a nice step up. Sounds fantastic. Has lots of features. Setup is easy (Hopefully the HDMI won't fail like it did on the TX-NR509). I have a PS4, XBox One, Wii U, Apple TV, PC and cable box running through it to a 60" TV and everything works great. This is a super nice receiver. I'm glad I bought it. Try to find it under $450 out the door.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Basically useless. Costumer service is bad
customer_reviews.text: Receiver broke within a year. Switches on and off when in use. Basically useless. Costumer service is awful. They expect you to pay shipping to have it fixed when they know they have a problem with this receiver. Read other reviews I am not alone. Update- working with company to have fixed. Have to talk to the right people. Sean O'Neill is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Shea

customer_reviews.title: A Surprisingly Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: While I don't know very much about sound systems or sound equipment, I have to say that I am very pleased with the versatility of this product (through its number of ports, CEC functionality, EQ set-up, etc) have left me pleasantly surprised and moreover happy that I don't have to go fiddling with wires, connections, settings, etc. depending upon whether or not I want to watch a movie in surround sound or just some local programming in stereo.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I should have read all the comments before buying this...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in June and installed it mid July. It was working great until 9/11... Now the HDMI out is not working and I cannot use a TV to see what it is doing, nor any movie. I have to rely on the small screen display, which is not very practical, for the setup. Of course the guarantee from the seller (Choose Us) is 30 days and I'll have to pay the return to Onkyo to have it repaired. I'm going to buy another brand as the board seems of dubious quality. Search Onkyo board problems online and plenty of forum posts will show up.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Dresse

customer_reviews.title: Overall the unit performs well and sounds great. It was disappointing to find that the USB ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall the unit performs well and sounds great. It was disappointing to find that the USB only supports streaming audio, not video. The network functionality does not work properly. It will not connect to wireless and when connected with a wired connection, cannot navigate to videos or audio that is not in a top level directory. It can find and open connections to network connected PCs, but cannot see attached external drives. I'm still waiting for Onkyo support to address the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Charmed

customer_reviews.title: Onkyo sucks!
customer_reviews.text: Buying an Onkyo is definitely a gamble. I had always heard they were good quality, but apparently they no longer are. After replacing an Onkyo with a problem, had it too long to return, I bought a new one on the say so of a friend. That one had problems so I returned it. Now the replacement I bought has a problem and after dealing with Onkyo customer NO-SERVICE trying to resolve it, it took long enough the unit can no longer be returned. DO NOT BUY ONKYO, unless you like to gamble!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: the quality seems a bit low after exchanging for Yamaha RX-V677
customer_reviews.text: Amp seemed a.little lower quality than what I have seen with previous Onkyo receivers. Seemed.like it got a little to warm and puts off lots of heat. Would have liked a 5v USB switched port in back. The Yamaha RX-V677 I exchanged this for has a better display and it does everything the Onkyo does and more. Menus and control over each speakers parametric eq are lacking a bit compared to Yamaha. 3 stars because of the low price otherwise 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopping

customer_reviews.title: Dead After 2.5 Years
customer_reviews.text: After about 2.5 years of light use, the left channel started hissing with loud static and progressed to shutting itself off with a loud bang. Don't believe the hype about Onkyo putting out a high quality product.
customer_reviews.author: DarkWater13

customer_reviews.title: was easy to hook up
customer_reviews.text: Replaces an older Onkyo, was easy to hook up, the remote came with my unit, I read some of the reviews saying they did not receive one. My box did look like it was opened before because the bag holding some of the contents was torn open but everything looked new. I have had this for a week, connected to my Amazon Fire TV, Playsation 3, Vizio TV and LG Blue Ray player and everything sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Styck

customer_reviews.title: Heat no problem, been on 8 years !
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine on continuously for 8 years. I leave it on all the time and have had no problem with it. All the features work. It runs hot on top but never a performance problem. REAL FINE product ! I use the sub bass output connected to a 250 Watt pro amplifier and an 18 inch speaker - it thunders and shakes the house so much I am afraid things might break. 7.1 sounds great
customer_reviews.author: jack

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: One word: Awesome!!! Researched for a new receiver for over a year and the Onkyo brand just kept coming to the top of the list. This product is of very high quality. The sound is great and there are so many features to future proof almost anyone that needs a receiver now. I paired this with Onkyo 7.2 speaker system and I am very satisfied with the whole new home theater experience that we get with this new system. I would highly recommend this product to anyone looking for high quality home theater equipment.
customer_reviews.author: joem

customer_reviews.title: Required resetting to operate.
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great, and it handles the HDMI switching better than models from a year ago. However, I've had to reset it four times in three months to get it to turn on. I don't know if this is a wide-spread fault, but I've had to take it to a repair depot, and will be without theater sound for at least 2 weeks. I've never had trouble with Onkyo audio equipment in the past. UPDATE: In service again. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon D Wilcox

customer_reviews.title: ONKYO HAS ALWAYS BEEN GOOD TO ME
customer_reviews.text: WHAT CAN I SAY. ONKYO HAS ALWAYS BEEN GOOD TO ME. I SAW SOME SNARKY COMMENTS ON THE WEB, BUT I LOVE IT. MY LAST ONE LASTED 9 YEARS-STILL WORKS. THIS ONE HAS MORE FEATURES AND POWER, AND YOU CAN'T BEAT THE PRICE. GO FOR IT!
customer_reviews.author: chuck rouse

customer_reviews.title: Blew out a capacitor at 29 months...BANG!
customer_reviews.text: Ran hot from the time it was purchased. Now at the 29-month mark, BANG! Blew out a capacitor and now it's deader than a dead thing. This was not enclosed in a cabinet and didn't have anything on top of it. It was on an open shelf. No excuse for overheating. Of course the warranty is 24 months, so no luck there. My previous Onkyo lasted 12 years. Was this a dud, or do the newer models have lower quality parts to keep the cost down? Can't say, but I don't think I'll be buying Onkyo again.
customer_reviews.author: PhoneGuy

customer_reviews.title: Delivery on-time and in excellent condition.  Receiver works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was on-time and product in excellent condition. The new Onkyo works GREAT in the media room set-up with the Polk Audio components ordered: 70RT, 75T, PSW125 and CS10!! I feel as though I am in a movie theater. I also used zone 2 to add outdoor speakers Atrium 4. Being a separte zone, I can play different stuff on each zone, which will be great for parties. The Dolby Atmos is awesome. Plenty of power to run the system. The whole system ROCKS!! Regards, Gary M. Frisco, TX
customer_reviews.author: Gary M.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have to keep the volume low (under 00 %). It will shutdown if I go above that. It also got overheated very easily if you let it play for a long time. Last month, It stopped playing and turned off by itself in the middle of my daughter's birthday party. Onkyo customer service agent told me that the unit is under warranty but they don't have any repair center in the Orlando area. I was asked to either drive 60 miles to drop it or pay to ship to Roseville, MI 48066. Be aware of the headache if you choose buy this Onkyo TX-NR636
customer_reviews.author: Sonson

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It has been a long time (years) since I purchased this and it has worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: als

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver. Good price
customer_reviews.text: All the features I was looking for I only find on Onkyo receivers. And I couldn't have been more satisfied with the TX-NR636. I got a really good price at Amazon for this unit. I was ready to buy a more expensive model when Amazon showed this unit on the side of my computer screen. I clicked on it and found that it also had the features I was looking for at for $100 less.
customer_reviews.author: Tenderfoot 1

customer_reviews.title: Faulty wiring leads to unit that will not stay on  DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Same as others, faulty wiring causes the unit to turn off immediately after turning on. Had it for 6 months, suddenly it will not stay on. I've tried the workaround from the Onkyo forums to unplug everything from it, wait an hour, plug it back in. No help. Waiting for Onkyo to respond to my support request is a joke. Last Onkyo product I'll ever own.
customer_reviews.author: kkjlk0806

customer_reviews.title: Very impress so far easy conection to all sources medias input
customer_reviews.text: Very impress so far easy conection to all sources medias input . my favorite is Pandora very easy to used. Movies experience is unreel on this receiver and for the money and all the features it has so far blown me away. If your looking to go home theather I wpould start with this receiver. Had a Yamaha but it did not do 4k and I just got the vizio p70 serie tv, needed a new reciever so after much research i decided on ths onkyo tx-nr636 7.2 receiver...
customer_reviews.author: lovtolive

customer_reviews.title: Simple Enough to set-up.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good receiver. I purchased it because it seemed to be the only one available with a preamp built-in for my turntable. I love my legacy albums. It is easy to set-up and separates all my streaming content to make them quite enjoyable to watch and listen to.
customer_reviews.author: Relwok

customer_reviews.title: so good, even though I have to re set once ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good, even though I have to re set once after speakers were blown (Monoprice failure), experimenting with new Fluance XL speakers' setting with additional Atmos modules on top. Very intuitive display for customized setting, many easy available adjustments/options, not overheating. Quality of sounds and pictures/movies reproduction is exceeding my expectations so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitri

customer_reviews.title: Good receiver for the money has some great functionality
customer_reviews.text: Good receiver for the money has some great functionality..I use the bluetooth to connect to my phone and play Spotify I also haver it connected to my wifi and could stream music that way as well. Easy to setup and does a pretty good job with surround sound. Has any easy to use App that I primarily use on my phone to control the unit. Happy overall.
customer_reviews.author: Nevets

customer_reviews.title: Great sound...
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, lots of inputs, plenty of power, passes 2k video through, upscales where needed. But the ease of use is only fair. You need to have a pretty wide amount of knowledge to really get the value out of this receiver. Dramatically improve the on-screen display and include a manual as thick as a Reader's Digest and you'll earn the other star...
customer_reviews.author: R. Baer

customer_reviews.title: Decent unit when new, but continually cuts on playing ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent unit when new, but continually cuts on playing 4K video. Moreover (and a caution for other products), the manufacturer support is abysmal and exudes indifference.
customer_reviews.author: MrJoel

customer_reviews.title: 12/2017 Update
customer_reviews.text: Great item. this is the third Onlyo receiver we have bought. It is perfect for our home. Sorry I know electronics, but not an expert. Good item at a good price. 12/2017 Update: This receive is two years old and just stopped working. This is the second time this brand has not lasted more than three years. I loved it but will not buy another. It is very expensive for not lasting very long. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: twkay

customer_reviews.title: After a very bad start with this receiver
customer_reviews.text: Sorry , I have to" Eat Crow". After a very bad start with this receiver, and a previous bad reveiw,(I Finally Figured out problems I was having) I have to say, this has a nice, full, deep rich Sound. And having heard some of the others Brands ,(Yamaha- 675 & Pioneer-VSX-1124 / Sound Flat in compaison) The TX- NR636 is Superior as a Music Platform, to the rest.. The negatives are >1, No operation manual.> 2,The Bass can be a little overpowering on some tracks . But, the Bass is also a positive feature for the most Part.
customer_reviews.author: steve c butler

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. HDMI signal from PC is shrunk leaving a black border around the edges.
customer_reviews.author: K. Royal

customer_reviews.title: Excellent receiver and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent receiver and easy to use. Full of features that I was looking for and sounds great. The app works perfectly with my iPhone to control the receiver Luke selecting inputs, controlling volume, and sound settings, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lau

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great with Energy 5.1 loudspeakers in a home theater setup
customer_reviews.author: AboveClouds

customer_reviews.title: If you have sensitive ears and a knack for music this combo is a great choice.
customer_reviews.text: Loving every single sound coming out of it. Combined with Energy 5.1 Take Classic Home Theater System and my ears are in heaven. My own personal DJ and the subwoofer just takes away the trophy. Be it games, music, movies, everything comes alive in my living room. Must buy. Have been using since 3 months and no complaints. If you have sensitive ears and a knack for music this combo is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Megha

customer_reviews.title: Powerful with tons of connections.
customer_reviews.text: Great receiver. Bought mine used and it was in perfect condition. No issues at all. Powerful enough to run my 9 satelites and 2 subs at high volumes. Wish it had DTSX but that's alright.
customer_reviews.author: Lester

customer_reviews.title: Takes awhile to setup but so worth it
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Wish it had more inputs, but great value
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Loaded with all the goodies...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use with lots of features. Purchased two from Amazon. One for my new theater room and one for my main TV room. Retired Pioneer Elite system that cost me almost twice as much when I purchased it roughly 10 years ago. This unit has all the features that anyone could want. You won't be disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: JBK

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Hard to rate until about a year of ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Hard to rate until about a year of use but I haven't had all the troubles some reviewers have sighted. Easy to set up, updated firmware and sounds good.
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Do not hesitate to buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I paired this with a pair of Polk RTiA7 speakers and I think I've died and went to stereo heaven. So far everything is just as advertised and Onkyo was responsive to any question I asked them.
customer_reviews.author: JJdeadhead

customer_reviews.title: truly a better experience. Having modern connection ability such as HDMI ...
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from and older system, truly a better experience. Having modern connection ability such as HDMI makes this a great investment in entertainment
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: This is a great sounding receiver and is "future proof" for several years
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before I bought this for the features compared to similar models. I also bought the Onkyo bookshelf speakers. This is a great sounding receiver and is "future proof" for several years. Be sure to buy from an Onkyo approved dealer for warranty purposes.
customer_reviews.author: DP.

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from Onkyo TX-NR636
customer_reviews.text: This product has power unit problems. Turns off by itself within a few seconds (tripping sound heard in power unit). We are trying to get it replaced/returned under 2 year warranty. Calling Onkyo Product support proved to be useless....no one picks it up even after hour long waiting!
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent unit. Great app lets me play my music ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent unit. Great app lets me play my music directly from my NAS. Excellent sound both music and for my home theater. Setup is a little complicated but really not bad.
customer_reviews.author: jjhs

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I am an audio enthusiast for many years. I use to like Bose until I bought EnergyTake 5 speakers with a combination of Onkyo NR636. This killer combination created sounds much better than Bose in these areas: (1) Mid frequencies are very clear (2) balanced full spectrum of frequency coverage (3) Signal to Noise Ratio (4) each sound can be distinguished (5) low price.
customer_reviews.author: Muhammad Qasim

customer_reviews.title: great product!
customer_reviews.text: This reciever exceeds my expectations. I opted for the square trade extended warrenty after my old pioneer reciever blew after only having it for two years. If anyone is having atmos issues, make sure your blu ray player has all secondary audio decoding off or it will not work. You can check by the input and output of audio using the Q button, then going to information and then audio. This feature was crutial to ensuring my atmos setup was working correctly. All in all, this reciever is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: richard delong

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and sound
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Have it for about 6 months now and I love the sound quality, and it works well with all my components like, tv, karaoke machine, DVR, speakers and wii.. I absolutely love it and recommend
customer_reviews.author: IMW

customer_reviews.title: Has unicorn sprinkles inside, MAGIC
customer_reviews.text: This receiver is absolutely worth the money. Sounds full and intense. Easy to set up and make adjustments with the nice on screen menu. I did not experience any of the negative hdmi issues others have described nor do you notice the sound fading after being left on for long periods of time as with other brands. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Kellogg

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended for the Price and Quality
customer_reviews.text: I am not an audiophile by any means. But the sound and useability of this receiver are top notch for the price. I paired it with the Energy Take Classic speaker system and am very impressed with my purchase. Also, what surprised me most was how much better the digital processing in the receiver made my TV look.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Fickling

customer_reviews.title: The item itself was garbage..
customer_reviews.text: The delivery and packing was superb. The item itself was garbage... Onkyo has fallen way below its old standards.
customer_reviews.author: jimww4963

customer_reviews.title: Unit will last just past waranty
customer_reviews.text: Unit came with a two year warranty. HDMI Port # 1 and Bluetooth function failed early in year 3. I will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: ben bast

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful sound separation, no muddiness.  Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great receiver with incredible sound separation and no muddiness - and is perfect for 5.1 or 7.2 surround sound systems. And it's a bonus that its future proof with 4K support and Dolby Atmos capabilities. But I mainly bought it for the incredible sound quality. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Arif Delawalla

customer_reviews.title: After 2 years of good use, this unit won't hold a HDMI signal ...
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years of good use, this unit won't hold a HDMI signal from a cable box or DVD. Onkyo acknowledged that this has been a known problem with this unit but stopped short of helping me repair it. I guess I now have a really expensive FM receiver. Not doing that again.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Jensen

customer_reviews.title: great!
customer_reviews.text: 1 of the only receivers on the market with hdcp 2.2 compliance for future 4k broadcasts. has a lot of features. great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lisanne

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with the audio quality
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with the audio quality. The only issue I've had so far is the calibration mic didn't work out of the box but the support staff promptly replaced it. Appreciate the fact that this amp has a phono input. Those are becoming rare these days.
customer_reviews.author: DenLee

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced for what it is
customer_reviews.text: Works well, has some quirks with my Vizio TV especially regarding on screen volume indicator but no major issues. Needs native AirPlay support!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason G

customer_reviews.title: Nice Atmos reciever
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is a great receiver. Absolutely love the Atmos, get it if you are on the fence
customer_reviews.author: J. Duecker

customer_reviews.title: Dead On Arrival
customer_reviews.text: After a painstaking 2hr install into a custom built in A/V cabinet... none of the speaker connections worked. None of them.
customer_reviews.author: D_Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all around receiver.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent receiver! you cannot beat the features on this unit for the price. You would pay hundreds more on another brand. Nice solid unit.

product_meta.title: Onkyo TX-NR636 7.2-Ch Dolby Atmos Ready Network A/V Receiver w/ HDMI 2.0
product_meta.description:
View larger BRING THE NEXT-GENERATION ENTERTAINMENT TO YOUR HOME
The TX-NR636 serves up revolutionary Dolby Atmos surround-sound complete with liquid 4K video at 60 frames per second. Dolby Atmos moves the sound around your theater more realistically to place you in the center of the action, creates a plane of sound over the listener’s head, and more accurately locates surround effects mixed for discrete channels. This receiver has HDMI supporting 4K/60 Hz and 21:9 display format and HDCP 2.2 copy-protection compatibility. Qdeo upscaling technology also converts low-res DVDs and games into pin-sharp Full HD or 4K (if you have an Ultra HD display). TX-NR636 paves the way for Ultra HD video playback at a liquid-smooth 60 frames per second. This is great news for PC gamers who can now add wall-shaking surround sound to their 4K/60 Hz experience.

UNSURPASSED BUILD QUALITY
Onkyo’s acclaimed WRAT (Wide Range Amplifier Technology), which provides the backbone that delivers Onkyo’s classic sound, is coupled with Three-stage inverted Darlington Circuitry to the LCR channel to provide a big soundstage, superb timing, brilliant definition, and enough low-end grunt to make your speakers sing. With 165 Watts/Ch (6ohms 1kHz, 2 Channels Driven, FTC) the TX-NR636 packs a colossal punch for movies but still retains the pure musicality you need for two-channel playback.

IT’S GOT ALL THE CONNECTIONS
Built-in Wi-Fi for universal hi-res streaming from PC, NAS, and smartphone is just the beginning. You can select from a wild variety of music streaming services and locate your network-attached libraries using the remote app, or stream almost any audio via built in Bluetooth. An HDMI/MHL terminal connects smartphones to display 1080p video with 7.1 channels of surround sound. Throw in a dedicated phono input, room equalization, and powered Zone 2 and you’ve got a value-packed 7.2-channel powerhouse ready for the next wave of high-resolution entertainment.


Firmware upgrade available now DOLBY ATMOS MULTIDIMENSIONAL SOUND
Onkyo is among the first to introduce the exciting Dolby Atmos surround-sound format to home theater environments. Dolby Atmos uses object-oriented mixing to layer independent audio elements through discrete channels, moving three-dimensional sound effects around the theater with astonishing realism. The format adapts to any home theater layout incorporating height channels for a more enveloping soundfield with extremely accurate directional and overhead effects.

HDMI 2.0 for UltraHDView larger SUPPORTING NEXT GENERATION HDMI 2.0 AND HDCP 2.2 COPY PROTECTION
The TX-NR636 is the first receiver to boast not only the latest HDMI connections supporting 4K/60Hz and 21:9 format but also the latest DMR copy protection compatibility, HDCP 2.2. By implementing the latest HDMI connections, supporting 4k/60Hz with HDCP 2.2, latest DRM content-protection method adopted for future premium 4K studio releases, 4K streaming via internet service providers, as well as for UHD terrestrial and satellite broadcasts, the TX-NR636 paves the way for Ultra HD video playback. Even if you’re not planning on upgrading your current display right away, your Onkyo receiver is ready for the future of gaming and video entertainment.

Built in WI-FI AND BLUETOOTH BUILT IN
The TX-NR636 has Wi-Fi and Bluetooth technologies built in. No wires, no dongles, no mess. Complete the one-time Wi-Fi setup, download our free control app for iOs and Android devices, and you’ve got a full range of remote control and audio streaming features in the palm of your hand. You can also pair your Bluetooth-capable device and stream direct to your home theater. With Advanced Music Optimizer DSP compensating for compression, music via Bluetooth has never sounded better.

View larger BUILT-IN INTERNET RADIO AND STREAMING
If you can think of it, you’ll most likely be able to stream it on your TX-NR636. The receiver comes loaded with Spotify, Pandora, SiriusXM Internet Radio, Rhapsody, AUPEO! and TuneIn, You can select a station and search for music available on these services via the free Onkyo app on your phone so you’ll never be short of your favorite music to enjoy.

Custom audio partsView larger HI-FI POWER AND FIDELITY
WRAT (Wide Range Amplifier Technology) is all about current. Receivers need a lot of current to not only handle the sudden explosive actions scenes but also to reproduce the detail of quiet passages. We use a massive high-power transformer to drive discrete amps that help eliminate distortion and preserve the energy of music and movies. Delivering 165 watts per channel, the TX-NR636 packs a colossal punch for movies but still retains the pure musicality you need for two-channel playback. Also, Phase-Matching Bass Enhancement optimizes low frequencies while preserving mid- range clarity. It counters phase shifting by synchronizing the timing of different frequencies. The result is deep, well-defined bass that won’t blur vocals or strings.

EXCLUSIVE ACCUEQ ROOM CALIBRATION
Calibrating the sound to suit your room’s acoustics is simple with AccuEQ. Once you’ve connected your speakers, plug-in the included mic and wait a few moments as the TX-NR636 measures things such as speaker distance, type, crossover, and output, taking into account any reflections from your walls and floor. The system is designed specifically to by-pass your front left and right speakers. The system then optimizes the frequency response of the remaining speakers so you can enjoy balanced surround sound regardless of room shape or furnishing while retaining the characteristics of your front left and right speakers for optimum enjoyment.
feature_bullets: Five of the receiver's seven HDMI inputs support 4K video at 60 frames per second Now you can add thunderous 7 2-channel surround-sound to the latest blockbuster 4K/60 Hz games and movies for a breathtakingly realistic entertainment experience

The Onkyo TX-NR636 doubles the power with two 32-bit processing engines decoding multichannel studio-resolution soundtracks along with a huge variety of HD audio files, including 5 6 MHz DSD (the same format used for Super Audio CD)

Built-in Wi-Fi and Bluetooth The remote app streams any music stored on your device, will locate and stream HD audio from network-attached devices The Advanced Music Optimizer restores compressed Bluetooth audio files to close to their original fidelity
Almost every HD and lossless format is supported, from FLAC and WAV to ALAC and WMA TX-NR636 also handles 5 6 MHz DSD and Dolby True HD formats for the ultimate in depth and clarity
AccuEQ by Onkyo simplifies the initial home theater setup process and makes both surround sound and two-channel audio more cohesive and realistic in your listening space
